text:
Hi everyone. I'm Jennifer from
English with Jennifer. Here's a short

lesson about the suffix -ity.
Think about the word "possibility." We all
spend time thinking about the possibilities life holds.
"Possibility" is a noun. The suffix

-ity tells me this. -ity
or -ty refers to a state.

Possibility is the state of being
possible.

Knowing suffixes can help you identify
parts of speech

and guess the meaning of a new word.
Knowing suffixes can also help you
predict word stress. With the suffix -ity,

we stress the syllable before the suffix.
Repeat after me.

Possibility. Possibility.
Notice how I change my /t/ to a flap t.
It sounds like a /d/. Instead of /ˌpɑsəˈbɪlɪti/,
I say /ˌpɑsəˈbɪlɪt̬i/in fast speech.
Let's say more words: clarity
unity
authority
security
minority
majority
sincerity
probability

Let me quiz you. If there's a possibility,
that means that something is

possible. Right? So, if i speak with
sincerity,
my words are...

sincere. If your writing has
clarity, then your ideas are...

clear. If you value home security,
you want your home to be...

secure. If you consider the probability
of an event,
you want to know if it's...
probable.

Let's increase the challenge and look at
a whole word family.
Choose the right words to complete the sentences.

Sadly, Cynthia didn't have much stability
in her childhood.
Her family moved around a lot.

The patient is doing much better, and
he's now in stable condition.

You need to stabilize the camera before
you start recording.
Note this word family: stable, stabilize, stability.
Stability.

We'll end here. Please review the words
from this lesson.

Remember that nouns can end in -ity or
-ty.

And the suffix refers to a state or a
quality.

Hopefully, you're developing your ability
to recognize word parts.

Please like the video if you found it
useful. As always, thanks for watching

and happy studies!
Follow me on Facebook, Twitter, and

Instagram. And try something new!
Download the app Hallo and join me for a

live stream!
Students can hop on camera and get
speaking practice in real time.
